meanings.definition: A person who participates in a lynching.
meanings.sent1: The town was shocked to discover that one of the lynchers was a respected community member.
meanings.sent2: The lynchers gathered in the dark of night, fueled by anger and hatred.
meanings.sent3: At the costume party, someone dressed up as a lyncher, causing both confusion and laughter.
meanings.sent4: The lynchers of justice swiftly carried out their own form of punishment.
meanings.sent5: The image of the lyncher haunted the dreams of the townspeople, a symbol of fear and injustice.
